sentence: It’s, as you’ve indicated, speaking of evil, it’s evil as well,” Romney told CNN’s Dana Bash on “State of the Union.” Advertisement He went on to call out Reps. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-Ga.) and Paul Gosar (R-Ariz.) for speaking at the third annual America First Political Action Conference, which was organized by white nationalist figurehead Nick Fuentes in Orlando, Florida.
author: Nina Golgowski
title: Sen. Mitt Romney Slams GOP 'Morons' At 'Evil' White Nationalist Conference

sentence: Asked by host Bash about Taylor Greene's appearance at the racist get-together in Orlando along with Rep. Paul Gosar (R-AZ) the Utah Republican didn't mince words when host Bash quoted a statement made by Rep. Liz Cheney (R-WY) that attacked the Georgia lawmaker.
author: Tom Boggioni
title: 'I have morons on my team': Mitt Romney questions Marjorie Taylor Greene's 'IQ' in brutal CNN rant

sentence: CNN host Dana Bash asked Romney about a tweet by Liz Cheney, where she slammed Republican leadership for their silence on the matter: As Rep Marjorie Taylor Greene and Rep Paul Gosar speak at this white supremacist, anti-Semitic, pro-Putin event, silence by Republican Party leaders is deafening and enabling.
author: Heather
title: Mitt Romney: 'I Have Morons On My Team!'

sentence: An image shared on Instagram purportedly shows a tweet from Republican Arizona Rep. Paul Gosar about being called a “moron.” Verdict: False The tweet has been digitally fabricated.
title: FACT CHECK: Did Paul Gosar Send This Tweet About Being Called A ‘Moron’?

sentence: An image shared on Instagram purportedly shows a tweet from Republican Arizona Rep. Paul Gosar about being called a “moron.” Verdict: False The tweet has been digitally fabricated.
author: Hannah Hudnall
title: FACT CHECK: Did Paul Gosar Send This Tweet About Being Called A ‘Moron’?
